\title{Post-Quantum Cryptography Benchmark Report\\
\large Timing Measurements on Raspberry Pi 4}
\author{Automated Analysis Script}
\date{January 2026}

\begin{document}

\maketitle

\begin{abstract}
This report presents timing measurements for post-quantum cryptographic algorithms
executed on a Raspberry Pi 4 Model B. All values are derived from benchmark JSON
files generated by \texttt{bench/benchmark\_pqc.py}. The report contains statistical
summaries and visualizations without interpretive conclusions.
\end{abstract}

\tableofcontents
\newpage

% =============================================================================
\section{Experimental Setup}
\label{sec:setup}
% =============================================================================

\subsection{Hardware Platform}

The benchmarks were executed on the following hardware platform:

\begin{table}[H]
\centering
\caption{Hardware Specifications}
\label{tab:hardware}
\begin{tabular}{@{}ll@{}}
\toprule
\textbf{Component} & \textbf{Specification} \\
\midrule
Device & Raspberry Pi 4 Model B Rev 1.5 \\
CPU & Broadcom BCM2711, Quad-core Cortex-A72 \\
Architecture & ARMv8-A (64-bit) \\
CPU Frequency & Up to 1.8 GHz \\
Memory & 4 GB LPDDR4-3200 \\
Frequency Governor & ondemand \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\end{table}

\textit{Source: \texttt{/proc/device-tree/model}, \texttt{/proc/cpuinfo}}

% =============================================================================
\section{Benchmark Methodology}
\label{sec:methodology}
% =============================================================================

\subsection{Measurement Approach}

The benchmark script implements dual timing measurement:

\begin{enumerate}
    \item \textbf{perf\_time\_ns}: High-resolution monotonic clock via \texttt{time.perf\_counter\_ns()}
    \item \textbf{wall\_time\_ns}: Wall clock time via \texttt{time.time\_ns()}
\end{enumerate}

\subsection{Iteration Configuration}

\begin{itemize}
    \item \textbf{Iterations per measurement}: 200
    \item \textbf{Warm-up iterations discarded}: 0
    \item \textbf{All iterations recorded}: Yes
\end{itemize}

\subsection{Operations Measured}

\begin{table}[H]
\centering
\caption{Operations by Algorithm Type}
\label{tab:operations}
\begin{tabular}{@{}ll@{}}
\toprule
\textbf{Algorithm Type} & \textbf{Operations} \\
\midrule
KEM & keygen, encapsulate, decapsulate \\
Signature & keygen, sign, verify \\
AEAD & encrypt, decrypt \\
Suite & full\_handshake \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\end{table}

\textit{Source: \texttt{bench/benchmark\_pqc.py}}

\section{KEM Benchmark Results}
\label{sec:kem}
% =============================================================================

\subsection{ML-KEM (NIST FIPS 203)}

\begin{table}[H]
\centering
\caption{ML-KEM Timing Statistics (n=200 iterations)}
\label{tab:mlkem}
\begin{tabular}{@{}llrrrrr@{}}
\toprule
\textbf{Algorithm} & \textbf{Operation} & \textbf{Mean (ms)} & \textbf{Median (ms)} & \textbf{Min (ms)} & \textbf{Max (ms)} \\
\midrule
ML-KEM-512 & keygen & 0.1160 & 0.0817 & 0.0800 & 6.4350 \\
ML-KEM-512 & encapsulate & 0.0658 & 0.0617 & 0.0602 & 0.3408 \\
ML-KEM-512 & decapsulate & 0.0706 & 0.0668 & 0.0654 & 0.3549 \\
\midrule
ML-KEM-768 & keygen & 0.1113 & 0.1073 & 0.1059 & 0.6638 \\
ML-KEM-768 & encapsulate & 0.0890 & 0.0860 & 0.0850 & 0.3614 \\
ML-KEM-768 & decapsulate & 0.0965 & 0.0941 & 0.0934 & 0.3479 \\
\midrule
ML-KEM-1024 & keygen & 0.1425 & 0.1362 & 0.1344 & 0.5097 \\
ML-KEM-1024 & encapsulate & 0.1208 & 0.1177 & 0.1167 & 0.3940 \\
ML-KEM-1024 & decapsulate & 0.1443 & 0.1363 & 0.1315 & 0.5510 \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\end{table}

\textit{Source: \texttt{bench\_results/raw/kem/ML\_KEM\_*.json}}

\section{NIST Level Comparison}
\label{sec:nistcompare}
% =============================================================================

\begin{table}[H]
\centering
\caption{KEM Operations Aggregated by NIST Level (Mean timing in ms)}
\label{tab:nist_kem}
\begin{tabular}{@{}lrrr@{}}
\toprule
\textbf{NIST Level} & \textbf{keygen} & \textbf{encapsulate} & \textbf{decapsulate} \\
\midrule
L1 (ML-KEM-512, McEliece-348864, HQC-128) & 118.53 & 15.00 & 42.86 \\
L3 (ML-KEM-768, McEliece-460896, HQC-192) & 394.25 & 45.38 & 100.23 \\
L5 (ML-KEM-1024, McEliece-8192128, HQC-256) & 2986.29 & 83.64 & 200.51 \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\end{table}

\textit{Note: Values are arithmetic means across all algorithms at each NIST level.}
\textit{Source: \texttt{bench\_analysis/stats/stats\_by\_nist\_level.csv}}

\begin{table}[H]
\centering
\caption{Signature Operations Aggregated by NIST Level (Mean timing in ms)}
\label{tab:nist_sig}
\begin{tabular}{@{}lrrr@{}}
\toprule
\textbf{NIST Level} & \textbf{keygen} & \textbf{sign} & \textbf{verify} \\
\midrule
L1 (ML-DSA-44, Falcon-512, SPHINCS+-128s) & 70.80 & 487.52 & 0.62 \\
L3 (ML-DSA-65, SPHINCS+-192s) & 140.65 & 1306.35 & 1.29 \\
L5 (ML-DSA-87, Falcon-1024, SPHINCS+-256s) & 79.23 & 772.48 & 1.31 \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\end{table}

\textit{Note: Values are arithmetic means across all algorithms at each NIST level.}
\textit{Source: \texttt{bench\_analysis/stats/stats\_by\_nist\_level.csv}}

% =============================================================================
\section{Data Sources}
\label{sec:sources}
% =============================================================================

All data in this report was derived from the following sources:

\begin{enumerate}
    \item \textbf{Environment metadata}: \texttt{bench\_results/environment.json}
    \item \textbf{KEM benchmarks}: \texttt{bench\_results/raw/kem/*.json} (27 files)
    \item \textbf{Signature benchmarks}: \texttt{bench\_results/raw/sig/*.json} (24 files)
    \item \textbf{AEAD benchmarks}: \texttt{bench\_results/raw/aead/*.json} (24 files)
    \item \textbf{Suite benchmarks}: \texttt{bench\_results/raw/suites/*.json} (23 files)
    \item \textbf{Benchmark script}: \texttt{bench/benchmark\_pqc.py}
    \item \textbf{Algorithm registry}: \texttt{core/suites.py}
\end{enumerate}

\end{document}
